intro: Hylodesmum podocarpum subsp. fallax, commonly known as the red-stemmed hylodesmum, is a member of the family Cistaceae. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, often hairy leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, and it is adapted to rocky and arid environments. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique stem coloration and habitat preferences.
